channel.title: Fun With Hardware
channel.description: Recent content on Fun With Hardware

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hi, I’m Nicholas Gregorich. AKA Nick. AKA Nico, Nik, Nic, Nich. I’m a hardwarista. hardwarista | noun: a person who makes and serves hardware to the public I’m a bit more than a decade into my career as a…well, let’s just say I put the general in generalist. Have my undergrad and graduate in electrical engineering Included a thesis WITH KNOBS titled: Audio Frequency Shifting On FPGA The first act of my career was doing FPGA applications support and design services Had a hobby in audio gear for makers (modular synthesizers) that grew into a company Did schematics / layout / code for funky FPGA and ARM Cortex audio engines Designed and manufactured hardware in China.

item.title: Blog Init
item.description: Hello world. It works! You can learn a little bit about me here. The Mission The year is 2020. There’s this virus going around, but that’s a story for another blog. We’ve all got a little extra time on our hands, so I want to dig into what it is I want to be able to build, acknowledge the skills I do have, fill in the gaps I don’t, and ship it (which in this case would simply mean calling it done-ish).
